H0.text: Mantle is the layer of Earth that is divided into plates.

H1.text: Crust is the layer of Earth that is divided into plates.

H2.text: Inner core is the layer of Earth that is divided into plates.

H3.text: Outer core is the layer of Earth that is divided into plates.

A4.text: The lithosphere is broken into tectonic plates whose motion allows heat to escape the interior of Earth into space.

A5.text: The outer layers of Earth are divided into the lithosphere and asthenosphere.

A6.text: The lithosphere is the rigid outer shell of the planet including the crust and upper mantle.

A7.text: The lithosphere exists as separate and distinct tectonic plates, which ride on the viscoelastic asthenosphere.

A8.text: Tectonic plates are relatively rigid and float across the ductile asthenosphere beneath.

A9.text: Mantle (geology), a layer in the interior of a planet

A10.text: Convection of the mantle propels the motion of the tectonic plates in the crust.
